definition: Euclid/abbr. for 歐幾里得|欧几里得
(used for transliteration)/old variant of 謳|讴[ou1]
Europe/abbr. for 歐洲|欧洲[Ou1 zhou1]/surname Ou
clan name/maiden name
see 月氏[Yue4 zhi1] and 閼氏|阏氏[yan1 zhi1]
Euclidean geometry

sentences.english: Euclidean quantum gravity applies the superposition principle to the entire universe.
sentences.chinese: 歐氏量子重力將疊加原理套用到整個宇宙。

sentences.english: Euclidean quantum gravity does not build in a notion of causality.
sentences.chinese: 歐氏量子重力並沒有預先置入因果律。

sentences.english: I have used Euclidean Distance but you could use any.
sentences.chinese: 我用歐氏距離，但你可以使用任何。

sentences.english: In the third chapter, we discuss the annealing process on the Euclidean space.
sentences.chinese: 第三章，我們考慮了歐氏空間上的退火過程。

sentences.english: The result using GTI model is somewhat inferior to Euclidean distance.
sentences.chinese: 使用GTI模型的結果比歐氏距離的要差。

sentences.english: for example, Euclidean space is invariant under rotations and translations.
sentences.chinese: 例如歐氏空間在旋轉和平移下都不會改變。

sentences.english: Character classification is realized by combining the Euclid distance and the Mahalanobis distance based on the projection coefficients.
sentences.chinese: 在此基礎上，組合歐氏距離和馬氏距離實現字符分類。

definition: a remote ancestor
Shixing County in Shaoguan 韶關|韶关[Shao2 guan1], Guangdong
posthumous name and title
Yongjia county in Wenzhou 溫州|温州[Wen1 zhou1], Zhejiang
sideroom/concubine
name of county
temple name of a deceased Chinese emperor
to bestow a surname (of emperor conferring favor on ethnic group)

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
Zanhuang county in Shijiazhuang 石家莊|石家庄[Shi2 jia1 zhuang1], Hebei
Yue state/generic term for states in south China or southeast Asia at different historical periods

same as 舊唐書|旧唐书[Jiu4 Tang2 shu1], History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls

History of Wei of the Northern Dynasties, tenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled by Wei Shou 魏收[Wei4 Shou1] in 554 during Northern Qi Dynasty 北齊|北齐[Bei3 Qi2], 114 scrolls
Bamboo Annals, early chronicle of Chinese ancient history, written c. 300 BC
Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479), with capital at Nanjing
general history of a county/county annals
